text: Miss Crawford ’s uneasiness was much lightened by this conversation , and she walked home again in spirits which might have defied almost another week of the same small party in the same bad weather , had they been put to the proof ; but as that very evening brought her brother down from London again in quite , or more than quite , his usual cheerfulness , she had nothing farther to try her own .
text_tokenized: Miss Crawford ’s uneasiness was much lightened by this conversation , and she walked home again in spirits which might have defied almost another week of the same small party in the same bad weather , had they been put to the proof ; but as that very evening brought her brother down from London again in quite , or more than quite , his usual cheerfulness , she had nothing farther to try her own .

text: His still refusing to tell her what he had gone for was but the promotion of gaiety ; a day before it might have irritated , but now it was a pleasant joke — suspected only of concealing something planned as a pleasant surprise to herself .
text_tokenized: His still refusing to tell her what he had gone for was but the promotion of gaiety ; a day before it might have irritated , but now it was a pleasant joke — suspected only of concealing something planned as a pleasant surprise to herself .

text: And the next day _ did _ bring a surprise to her .
text_tokenized: And the next day _ did _ bring a surprise to her .

text: Henry had said he should just go and ask the Bertrams how they did , and be back in ten minutes , but he was gone above an hour ;
text_tokenized: Henry had said he should just go and ask the Bertrams how they did , and be back in ten minutes , but he was gone above an hour ;

text: and
text_tokenized: and

text: when his sister , who had been waiting for him to walk with her in the garden , met him at last most impatiently in the sweep , and cried out , “ My dear Henry , where can you have been all this time ? ” he had only to say that he had been sitting with Lady Bertram and Fanny . “ Sitting with them an hour and a half ! ” exclaimed Mary .
text_tokenized: when his sister , who had been waiting for him to walk with her in the garden , met him at last most impatiently in the sweep , and cried out , “ My dear Henry , where can you have been all this time ? ” he had only to say that he had been sitting with Lady Bertram and Fanny . “ Sitting with them an hour and a half ! ” exclaimed Mary .

text: But this was only the beginning of her surprise .
text_tokenized: But this was only the beginning of her surprise .

text: “ Yes , Mary , ” said he , drawing her arm within his , and walking along the sweep as if not knowing where he was : “ I could not get away sooner ; Fanny looked so lovely !
text_tokenized: “ Yes , Mary , ” said he , drawing her arm within his , and walking along the sweep as if not knowing where he was : “ I could not get away sooner ; Fanny looked so lovely !

text: I am quite determined , Mary .
text_tokenized: I am quite determined , Mary .

text: My mind is entirely made up .
text_tokenized: My mind is entirely made up .

text: Will it astonish you ?
text_tokenized: Will it astonish you ?

text: No : you must be aware that I am quite determined to marry Fanny Price . ” The surprise was now complete ; for , in spite of whatever his consciousness might suggest , a suspicion of his having any such views had never entered his sister ’s imagination ; and she looked so truly the astonishment she felt , that he was obliged to repeat what he had said , and more fully and more solemnly .
text_tokenized: No : you must be aware that I am quite determined to marry Fanny Price . ” The surprise was now complete ; for , in spite of whatever his consciousness might suggest , a suspicion of his having any such views had never entered his sister ’s imagination ; and she looked so truly the astonishment she felt , that he was obliged to repeat what he had said , and more fully and more solemnly .

text: The conviction of his determination once admitted , it was not unwelcome .
text_tokenized: The conviction of his determination once admitted , it was not unwelcome .

text: There was even pleasure with the surprise .
text_tokenized: There was even pleasure with the surprise .

text: Mary was in a state of mind to rejoice in a connexion with the Bertram family , and to be not displeased with her brother ’s marrying a little beneath him .
text_tokenized: Mary was in a state of mind to rejoice in a connexion with the Bertram family , and to be not displeased with her brother ’s marrying a little beneath him .

text: “ Yes , Mary , ” was Henry ’s concluding assurance .
text_tokenized: “ Yes , Mary , ” was Henry ’s concluding assurance .

text: “ I am fairly caught .
text_tokenized: “ I am fairly caught .

text: You know with what idle designs I began ; but this is the end of them .
text_tokenized: You know with what idle designs I began ; but this is the end of them .

text: I have , I flatter myself , made no inconsiderable progress in her affections ; but my own are entirely fixed .
text_tokenized: I have , I flatter myself , made no inconsiderable progress in her affections ; but my own are entirely fixed .

text: “ Lucky , lucky girl ! ” cried Mary , as soon as she could speak ; “ what a match for her !
text_tokenized: “ Lucky , lucky girl ! ” cried Mary , as soon as she could speak ; “ what a match for her !

text: My dearest Henry , this must be my _ first _ feeling ; but my _ second _ , which you shall have as sincerely , is , that I approve your choice from my soul , and foresee your happiness as heartily as I wish and desire it .
text_tokenized: My dearest Henry , this must be my _ first _ feeling ; but my _ second _ , which you shall have as sincerely , is , that I approve your choice from my soul , and foresee your happiness as heartily as I wish and desire it .

text: You will have a sweet little wife ; all gratitude and devotion .
text_tokenized: You will have a sweet little wife ; all gratitude and devotion .

text: Exactly what you deserve .
text_tokenized: Exactly what you deserve .

text: What an amazing match for her !
text_tokenized: What an amazing match for her !

text: Mrs. Norris often talks of her luck ; what will she say now ?
text_tokenized: Mrs. Norris often talks of her luck ; what will she say now ?

text: The delight of all the family , indeed !
text_tokenized: The delight of all the family , indeed !

text: And she has some _ true _ friends in it !
text_tokenized: And she has some _ true _ friends in it !

text: How _ they _ will rejoice !
text_tokenized: How _ they _ will rejoice !

text: But tell me all about it !
text_tokenized: But tell me all about it !

text: Talk to me for ever .
text_tokenized: Talk to me for ever .

text: When did you begin to think seriously about her ? ” Nothing could be more impossible than to answer such a question , though nothing could be more agreeable than to have it asked .
text_tokenized: When did you begin to think seriously about her ? ” Nothing could be more impossible than to answer such a question , though nothing could be more agreeable than to have it asked .

text: “ How the pleasing plague had stolen on him ” he could not say ; and before he had expressed the same sentiment with a little variation of words three times over , his sister eagerly interrupted him with , “ Ah , my dear Henry , and this is what took you to London !
text_tokenized: “ How the pleasing plague had stolen on him ” he could not say ; and before he had expressed the same sentiment with a little variation of words three times over , his sister eagerly interrupted him with , “ Ah , my dear Henry , and this is what took you to London !

text: This was your business !
text_tokenized: This was your business !

text: You chose to consult the Admiral before you made up your mind . ” But this he stoutly denied .
text_tokenized: You chose to consult the Admiral before you made up your mind . ” But this he stoutly denied .

text: He knew his uncle too well to consult him on any matrimonial scheme .
text_tokenized: He knew his uncle too well to consult him on any matrimonial scheme .

text: The Admiral hated marriage , and thought it never pardonable in a young man of independent fortune .
text_tokenized: The Admiral hated marriage , and thought it never pardonable in a young man of independent fortune .

text: “ When Fanny is known to him , ” continued Henry , “ he will doat on her .
text_tokenized: “ When Fanny is known to him , ” continued Henry , “ he will doat on her .

text: She is exactly the woman to do away every prejudice of such a man as the Admiral , for she is exactly such a woman as he thinks does not exist in the world .
text_tokenized: She is exactly the woman to do away every prejudice of such a man as the Admiral , for she is exactly such a woman as he thinks does not exist in the world .

text: She is the very impossibility he would describe , if indeed he has now delicacy of language enough to embody his own ideas .
text_tokenized: She is the very impossibility he would describe , if indeed he has now delicacy of language enough to embody his own ideas .

text: But till it is absolutely settled — settled beyond all interference , he shall know nothing of the matter .
text_tokenized: But till it is absolutely settled — settled beyond all interference , he shall know nothing of the matter .

text: No , Mary , you are quite mistaken .
text_tokenized: No , Mary , you are quite mistaken .

text: You have not discovered my business yet .
text_tokenized: You have not discovered my business yet .

text: “ Well , well , I am satisfied .
text_tokenized: “ Well , well , I am satisfied .

text: I know now to whom it must relate , and am in no hurry for the rest .
text_tokenized: I know now to whom it must relate , and am in no hurry for the rest .

text: Fanny Price !
text_tokenized: Fanny Price !

text: wonderful , quite wonderful !
text_tokenized: wonderful , quite wonderful !

text: That Mansfield should have done so much for — that _ you _ should have found your fate in Mansfield !
text_tokenized: That Mansfield should have done so much for — that _ you _ should have found your fate in Mansfield !

text: But you are quite right ; you could not have chosen better .
text_tokenized: But you are quite right ; you could not have chosen better .

text: There is not a better girl in the world , and you do not want for fortune ; and as to her connexions , they are more than good .
text_tokenized: There is not a better girl in the world , and you do not want for fortune ; and as to her connexions , they are more than good .

text: The Bertrams are undoubtedly some of the first people in this country .
text_tokenized: The Bertrams are undoubtedly some of the first people in this country .

text: She is niece to Sir Thomas Bertram ; that will be enough for the world .
text_tokenized: She is niece to Sir Thomas Bertram ; that will be enough for the world .

text: But go on , go on .
text_tokenized: But go on , go on .

text: Tell me more .
text_tokenized: Tell me more .

text: What are your plans ?
text_tokenized: What are your plans ?

text: Does she know her own happiness ? ” “ No . ” “ What are you waiting for ? ” “ For — for very little more than opportunity .
text_tokenized: Does she know her own happiness ? ” “ No . ” “ What are you waiting for ? ” “ For — for very little more than opportunity .

text: Mary , she is not like her cousins ; but I think I shall not ask in vain . ”
text_tokenized: Mary , she is not like her cousins ; but I think I shall not ask in vain . ”

text: “ Oh no !
text_tokenized: “ Oh no !

text: you can not .
text_tokenized: you can not .

text: Were you even less pleasing — supposing her not to love you already ( of which , however , I can have little doubt)—you would be safe .
text_tokenized: Were you even less pleasing — supposing her not to love you already ( of which , however , I can have little doubt)—you would be safe .

text: The gentleness and gratitude of her disposition would secure her all your own immediately .
text_tokenized: The gentleness and gratitude of her disposition would secure her all your own immediately .

text: From my soul I do not think she would marry you _ without _ love ; that is , if there is a girl in the world capable of being uninfluenced by ambition
text_tokenized: From my soul I do not think she would marry you _ without _ love ; that is , if there is a girl in the world capable of being uninfluenced by ambition

text: , I can suppose it her ; but ask her to love you , and she will never have the heart to refuse .
text_tokenized: , I can suppose it her ; but ask her to love you , and she will never have the heart to refuse .

text: As soon as her eagerness could rest in silence , he was as happy to tell as she could be to listen ; and a conversation followed almost as deeply interesting to her as to himself , though he had in fact nothing to relate but his own sensations , nothing to dwell on but Fanny ’s charms . Fanny ’s beauty of face and figure , Fanny ’s graces of manner and goodness of heart , were the exhaustless theme .
text_tokenized: As soon as her eagerness could rest in silence , he was as happy to tell as she could be to listen ; and a conversation followed almost as deeply interesting to her as to himself , though he had in fact nothing to relate but his own sensations , nothing to dwell on but Fanny ’s charms . Fanny ’s beauty of face and figure , Fanny ’s graces of manner and goodness of heart , were the exhaustless theme .

text: The gentleness , modesty , and sweetness of her character were warmly expatiated on ; that sweetness which makes so essential a part of every woman ’s worth in the judgment of man , that though he sometimes loves where it is not , he can never believe it absent .
text_tokenized: The gentleness , modesty , and sweetness of her character were warmly expatiated on ; that sweetness which makes so essential a part of every woman ’s worth in the judgment of man , that though he sometimes loves where it is not , he can never believe it absent .

text: Her temper he had good reason to depend on and to praise .
text_tokenized: Her temper he had good reason to depend on and to praise .

text: He had often seen it tried .
text_tokenized: He had often seen it tried .

text: Was there one of the family , excepting Edmund , who had not in some way or other continually exercised her patience and forbearance ?
text_tokenized: Was there one of the family , excepting Edmund , who had not in some way or other continually exercised her patience and forbearance ?

text: Her affections were evidently strong .
text_tokenized: Her affections were evidently strong .

text: To see her with her brother !
text_tokenized: To see her with her brother !

text: What could more delightfully prove that the warmth of her heart was equal to its gentleness ?
text_tokenized: What could more delightfully prove that the warmth of her heart was equal to its gentleness ?

text: What could be more encouraging to a man who had her love in view ?
text_tokenized: What could be more encouraging to a man who had her love in view ?

text: Then , her understanding was beyond every suspicion , quick and clear ; and her manners were the mirror of her own modest and elegant mind .
text_tokenized: Then , her understanding was beyond every suspicion , quick and clear ; and her manners were the mirror of her own modest and elegant mind .

text: Nor was this all .
text_tokenized: Nor was this all .

text: Henry Crawford had too much sense not to feel the worth of good principles in a wife , though he was too little accustomed to serious reflection to know them by their proper name ; but when he talked of her having such a steadiness and regularity of conduct , such a high notion of honour , and such an observance of decorum as might warrant any man in the fullest dependence on her faith and integrity , he expressed what was inspired by the knowledge of her being well principled and religious . “ I could so wholly and absolutely confide in her , ” said he ; “ and _ that _ is what I want . ”
text_tokenized: Henry Crawford had too much sense not to feel the worth of good principles in a wife , though he was too little accustomed to serious reflection to know them by their proper name ; but when he talked of her having such a steadiness and regularity of conduct , such a high notion of honour , and such an observance of decorum as might warrant any man in the fullest dependence on her faith and integrity , he expressed what was inspired by the knowledge of her being well principled and religious . “ I could so wholly and absolutely confide in her , ” said he ; “ and _ that _ is what I want . ”

text: Well might his sister , believing as she really did that his opinion of Fanny Price was scarcely beyond her merits , rejoice in her prospects .
text_tokenized: Well might his sister , believing as she really did that his opinion of Fanny Price was scarcely beyond her merits , rejoice in her prospects .

text: “ The more I think of it , ” she cried , “ the more am I convinced that you are doing quite right ; and though I should never have selected Fanny Price as the girl most likely to attach you , I am now persuaded she is the very one to make you happy .
text_tokenized: “ The more I think of it , ” she cried , “ the more am I convinced that you are doing quite right ; and though I should never have selected Fanny Price as the girl most likely to attach you , I am now persuaded she is the very one to make you happy .

text: Your wicked project upon her peace turns out a clever thought indeed .
text_tokenized: Your wicked project upon her peace turns out a clever thought indeed .

text: You will both find your good in it . ”
text_tokenized: You will both find your good in it . ”

text: “ It was bad , very bad in me against such a creature ; but I did not know her then ; and she shall have no reason to lament the hour that first put it into my head .
text_tokenized: “ It was bad , very bad in me against such a creature ; but I did not know her then ; and she shall have no reason to lament the hour that first put it into my head .

text: I will make her very happy , Mary ; happier than she has ever yet been herself , or ever seen anybody else .
text_tokenized: I will make her very happy , Mary ; happier than she has ever yet been herself , or ever seen anybody else .

text: I will not take her from Northamptonshire .
text_tokenized: I will not take her from Northamptonshire .

text: I shall let Everingham , and rent a place in this neighbourhood ; perhaps Stanwix Lodge .
text_tokenized: I shall let Everingham , and rent a place in this neighbourhood ; perhaps Stanwix Lodge .

text: I shall let a seven years ’ lease of Everingham .
text_tokenized: I shall let a seven years ’ lease of Everingham .

text: I am sure of an excellent tenant at half a word .
text_tokenized: I am sure of an excellent tenant at half a word .

text: I could name three people now , who would give me my own terms and thank me .
text_tokenized: I could name three people now , who would give me my own terms and thank me .

text: ” “ Ha ! ” cried Mary ; “ settle in Northamptonshire !
text_tokenized: ” “ Ha ! ” cried Mary ; “ settle in Northamptonshire !

text: That is pleasant !
text_tokenized: That is pleasant !

text: Then we shall be all together . ”
text_tokenized: Then we shall be all together . ”

text: When she had spoken it , she recollected herself , and wished it unsaid ; but there was no need of confusion ; for her brother saw her only as the supposed inmate of Mansfield parsonage , and replied but to invite her in the kindest manner to his own house , and to claim the best right in her .
text_tokenized: When she had spoken it , she recollected herself , and wished it unsaid ; but there was no need of confusion ; for her brother saw her only as the supposed inmate of Mansfield parsonage , and replied but to invite her in the kindest manner to his own house , and to claim the best right in her .

text: “ You must give us more than half your time , ” said he .
text_tokenized: “ You must give us more than half your time , ” said he .

text: “ I can not admit Mrs. Grant to have an equal claim with Fanny and myself , for we shall both have a right in you .
text_tokenized: “ I can not admit Mrs. Grant to have an equal claim with Fanny and myself , for we shall both have a right in you .

text: Fanny will be so truly your sister ! ”
text_tokenized: Fanny will be so truly your sister ! ”

text: Mary had only to be grateful and give general assurances ; but she was now very fully purposed to be the guest of neither brother nor sister many months longer .
text_tokenized: Mary had only to be grateful and give general assurances ; but she was now very fully purposed to be the guest of neither brother nor sister many months longer .

text: “ You will divide your year between London and Northamptonshire ? ” “ Yes . ” “ That ’s right ; and in London , of course , a house of your own : no longer with the Admiral .
text_tokenized: “ You will divide your year between London and Northamptonshire ? ” “ Yes . ” “ That ’s right ; and in London , of course , a house of your own : no longer with the Admiral .

text: My dearest Henry , the advantage to you of getting away from the Admiral before your manners are hurt by the contagion of his , before you have contracted any of his foolish opinions , or learned to sit over your dinner as if it were the best blessing of life !
text_tokenized: My dearest Henry , the advantage to you of getting away from the Admiral before your manners are hurt by the contagion of his , before you have contracted any of his foolish opinions , or learned to sit over your dinner as if it were the best blessing of life !

text: _ You _ are not sensible of the gain , for your regard for him has blinded you ; but , in my estimation , your marrying early may be the saving of you .
text_tokenized: _ You _ are not sensible of the gain , for your regard for him has blinded you ; but , in my estimation , your marrying early may be the saving of you .

text: To have seen you grow like the Admiral in word or deed , look or gesture , would have broken my heart . ” “ Well , well , we do not think quite alike here .
text_tokenized: To have seen you grow like the Admiral in word or deed , look or gesture , would have broken my heart . ” “ Well , well , we do not think quite alike here .

text: The Admiral has his faults , but he is a very good man , and has been more than a father to me . Few fathers would have let me have my own way half so much .
text_tokenized: The Admiral has his faults , but he is a very good man , and has been more than a father to me . Few fathers would have let me have my own way half so much .

text: You must not prejudice Fanny against him .
text_tokenized: You must not prejudice Fanny against him .

text: I must have them love one another . ”
text_tokenized: I must have them love one another . ”

text: Mary refrained from saying what she felt , that there could not be two persons in existence whose characters and manners were less accordant : time would discover it to him ; but she could not help _ this _ reflection on the Admiral .
text_tokenized: Mary refrained from saying what she felt , that there could not be two persons in existence whose characters and manners were less accordant : time would discover it to him ; but she could not help _ this _ reflection on the Admiral .

text: “ Henry , I think so highly of Fanny Price , that if I could suppose the next Mrs. Crawford would have half the reason which my poor ill - used aunt had to abhor the very name , I would prevent the marriage , if possible ;
text_tokenized: “ Henry , I think so highly of Fanny Price , that if I could suppose the next Mrs. Crawford would have half the reason which my poor ill - used aunt had to abhor the very name , I would prevent the marriage , if possible ;

text: but I know you : I know that a wife you _ loved _ would be the happiest of women , and that even when you ceased to love , she would yet find in you the liberality and good - breeding of a gentleman .
text_tokenized: but I know you : I know that a wife you _ loved _ would be the happiest of women , and that even when you ceased to love , she would yet find in you the liberality and good - breeding of a gentleman .

text: The impossibility of not doing everything in the world to make Fanny Price happy , or of ceasing to love Fanny Price , was of course the groundwork of his eloquent answer .
text_tokenized: The impossibility of not doing everything in the world to make Fanny Price happy , or of ceasing to love Fanny Price , was of course the groundwork of his eloquent answer .

text: “ Had you seen her this morning , Mary , ” he continued , “ attending with such ineffable sweetness and patience to all the demands of her aunt ’s stupidity , working with her , and for her , her colour beautifully heightened as she leant over the work , then returning to her seat to finish a note which she was previously engaged in writing for that stupid woman ’s service , and all this with such unpretending gentleness , so much as if it were a matter of course that she was not to have a moment at her own command , her hair arranged as neatly as it always is , and one little curl falling forward as she wrote , which she now and then shook back , and in the midst of all this , still speaking at intervals to _ me _ , or listening , and as if she liked to listen , to what I said .
text_tokenized: “ Had you seen her this morning , Mary , ” he continued , “ attending with such ineffable sweetness and patience to all the demands of her aunt ’s stupidity , working with her , and for her , her colour beautifully heightened as she leant over the work , then returning to her seat to finish a note which she was previously engaged in writing for that stupid woman ’s service , and all this with such unpretending gentleness , so much as if it were a matter of course that she was not to have a moment at her own command , her hair arranged as neatly as it always is , and one little curl falling forward as she wrote , which she now and then shook back , and in the midst of all this , still speaking at intervals to _ me _ , or listening , and as if she liked to listen , to what I said .

text: Had you seen her so , Mary , you would not have implied the possibility of her power over my heart ever ceasing . ”
text_tokenized: Had you seen her so , Mary , you would not have implied the possibility of her power over my heart ever ceasing . ”

text: “ My dearest Henry , ” cried Mary , stopping short , and smiling in his face , “ how glad I am to see you so much in love !
text_tokenized: “ My dearest Henry , ” cried Mary , stopping short , and smiling in his face , “ how glad I am to see you so much in love !

text: It quite delights me .
text_tokenized: It quite delights me .

text: But what will Mrs. Rushworth and Julia say ? ”
text_tokenized: But what will Mrs. Rushworth and Julia say ? ”

text: “ I care neither what they say nor what they feel .
text_tokenized: “ I care neither what they say nor what they feel .

text: They will now see what sort of woman it is that can attach me , that can attach a man of sense .
text_tokenized: They will now see what sort of woman it is that can attach me , that can attach a man of sense .

text: I wish the discovery may do them any good .
text_tokenized: I wish the discovery may do them any good .

text: And they will now see their cousin treated as she ought to be , and I wish they may be heartily ashamed of their own abominable neglect and unkindness .
text_tokenized: And they will now see their cousin treated as she ought to be , and I wish they may be heartily ashamed of their own abominable neglect and unkindness .

text: They will be angry , ” he added , after a moment ’s silence , and in a cooler tone ; “ Mrs. Rushworth will be very angry .
text_tokenized: They will be angry , ” he added , after a moment ’s silence , and in a cooler tone ; “ Mrs. Rushworth will be very angry .

text: It will be a bitter pill to her ; that is , like other bitter pills , it will have two moments ’ ill flavour , and then be swallowed and forgotten ; for I am not such a coxcomb as to suppose her feelings more lasting than other women ’s , though _ I _ was the object of them .
text_tokenized: It will be a bitter pill to her ; that is , like other bitter pills , it will have two moments ’ ill flavour , and then be swallowed and forgotten ; for I am not such a coxcomb as to suppose her feelings more lasting than other women ’s , though _ I _ was the object of them .

text: Yes , Mary , my Fanny will feel a difference indeed : a daily , hourly difference , in the behaviour of every being who approaches her ; and it will be the completion of my happiness to know that I am the doer of it , that I am the person to give the consequence so justly her due .
text_tokenized: Yes , Mary , my Fanny will feel a difference indeed : a daily , hourly difference , in the behaviour of every being who approaches her ; and it will be the completion of my happiness to know that I am the doer of it , that I am the person to give the consequence so justly her due .

text: Now she is dependent , helpless , friendless , neglected , forgotten .
text_tokenized: Now she is dependent , helpless , friendless , neglected , forgotten .

text: “ Nay , Henry , not by all ; not forgotten by all ; not friendless or forgotten . Her cousin Edmund never forgets her .
text_tokenized: “ Nay , Henry , not by all ; not forgotten by all ; not friendless or forgotten . Her cousin Edmund never forgets her .

text: “ Edmund !
text_tokenized: “ Edmund !

text: True , I believe he is , generally speaking , kind to her , and so is Sir Thomas in his way ; but it is the way of a rich , superior , long - worded , arbitrary uncle .
text_tokenized: True , I believe he is , generally speaking , kind to her , and so is Sir Thomas in his way ; but it is the way of a rich , superior , long - worded , arbitrary uncle .

text: What can Sir Thomas and Edmund together do , what _ do _ they do for her happiness , comfort , honour , and dignity in the world , to what I _ shall _ do ? ”
text_tokenized: What can Sir Thomas and Edmund together do , what _ do _ they do for her happiness , comfort , honour , and dignity in the world , to what I _ shall _ do ? ”

text: XXXI Henry Crawford was at Mansfield Park again the next morning , and at an earlier hour than common visiting warrants .
text_tokenized: XXXI Henry Crawford was at Mansfield Park again the next morning , and at an earlier hour than common visiting warrants .

text: The two ladies were together in the breakfast - room , and , fortunately for him , Lady Bertram was on the very point of quitting it as he entered .
text_tokenized: The two ladies were together in the breakfast - room , and , fortunately for him , Lady Bertram was on the very point of quitting it as he entered .

text: She was almost at the door , and not chusing by any means to take so much trouble in vain , she still went on , after a civil reception , a short sentence about being waited for , and a “ Let Sir Thomas know ” to the servant .
text_tokenized: She was almost at the door , and not chusing by any means to take so much trouble in vain , she still went on , after a civil reception , a short sentence about being waited for , and a “ Let Sir Thomas know ” to the servant .

text: Henry , overjoyed to have her go , bowed and watched her off , and without losing another moment , turned instantly to Fanny , and , taking out some letters , said , with a most animated look , “ I must acknowledge myself infinitely obliged to any creature who gives me such an opportunity of seeing you alone : I have been wishing it more than you can have any idea . Knowing as I do what your feelings as a sister are , I could hardly have borne that any one in the house should share with you in the first knowledge of the news I now bring .
text_tokenized: Henry , overjoyed to have her go , bowed and watched her off , and without losing another moment , turned instantly to Fanny , and , taking out some letters , said , with a most animated look , “ I must acknowledge myself infinitely obliged to any creature who gives me such an opportunity of seeing you alone : I have been wishing it more than you can have any idea . Knowing as I do what your feelings as a sister are , I could hardly have borne that any one in the house should share with you in the first knowledge of the news I now bring .

text: He is made .
text_tokenized: He is made .

text: Your brother is a lieutenant .

text: I have the infinite satisfaction of congratulating you on your brother ’s promotion .
text_tokenized: I have the infinite satisfaction of congratulating you on your brother ’s promotion .

text: Here are the letters which announce it , this moment come to hand .
text_tokenized: Here are the letters which announce it , this moment come to hand .

text_tokenized: You will , perhaps , like to see them .

text: Fanny could not speak , but he did not want her to speak .
text_tokenized: Fanny could not speak , but he did not want her to speak .

text: To see the expression of her eyes , the change of her complexion , the progress of her feelings , their doubt , confusion , and felicity , was enough .

text: The first was from the Admiral to inform his nephew , in a few words , of his having succeeded in the object he had undertaken , the promotion of young Price , and enclosing two more , one from the Secretary of the First Lord to a friend , whom the Admiral had set to work in the business , the other from that friend to himself , by which it appeared that his lordship had the very great happiness of attending to the recommendation of Sir Charles ; that Sir Charles was much delighted in having such an opportunity of proving his regard for Admiral Crawford , and that the circumstance of Mr. William Price ’s commission as Second Lieutenant of H.M. Sloop Thrush being made out was spreading general joy through a wide circle of great people .

Sloop Thrush being made out was spreading general joy through a wide circle of great people .

text: While her hand was trembling under these letters , her eye running from one to the other , and her heart swelling with emotion , Crawford thus continued , with unfeigned eagerness , to express his interest in the event — “ I will not talk of my own happiness , ” said he , “ great as it is , for I think only of yours .

text: Compared with you , who has a right to be happy ?

text: I have almost grudged myself my own prior knowledge of what you ought to have known before all the world .

text: I have not lost a moment , however .

text: The post was late this morning , but there has not been since a moment ’s delay .

text: How impatient , how anxious , how wild I have been on the subject , I will not attempt to describe ; how severely mortified , how cruelly disappointed , in not having it finished while I was in London !
text_tokenized: How impatient , how anxious , how wild I have been on the subject , I will not attempt to describe ; how severely mortified , how cruelly disappointed , in not having it finished while I was in London !

text: I was kept there from day to day in the hope of it , for nothing less dear to me than such an object would have detained me half the time from Mansfield .
text_tokenized: I was kept there from day to day in the hope of it , for nothing less dear to me than such an object would have detained me half the time from Mansfield .

text: But though my uncle entered into my wishes with all the warmth I could desire , and exerted himself immediately , there were difficulties from the absence of one friend , and the engagements of another , which at last I could no longer bear to stay the end of , and knowing in what good hands I left the cause , I came away on Monday , trusting that many posts would not pass before I should be followed by such very letters as these .

text: My uncle , who is the very best man in the world , has exerted himself , as I knew he would , after seeing your brother .

text: When she did understand it , however , and found herself expected to believe that she had created sensations which his heart had never known before , and that everything he had done for William was to be placed to the account of his excessive and unequalled attachment to her , she was exceedingly distressed , and for some moments unable to speak .
text_tokenized: When she did understand it , however , and found herself expected to believe that she had created sensations which his heart had never known before , and that everything he had done for William was to be placed to the account of his excessive and unequalled attachment to her , she was exceedingly distressed , and for some moments unable to speak .

text: She considered it all as nonsense , as mere trifling and gallantry , which meant only to deceive for the hour ; she could not but feel that it was treating her improperly and unworthily , and in such a way as she had not deserved ; but it was like himself , and entirely of a piece with what she had seen before ; and she would not allow herself to shew half the displeasure she felt , because he had been conferring an obligation , which no want of delicacy on his part could make a trifle to her .
text_tokenized: She considered it all as nonsense , as mere trifling and gallantry , which meant only to deceive for the hour ; she could not but feel that it was treating her improperly and unworthily , and in such a way as she had not deserved ; but it was like himself , and entirely of a piece with what she had seen before ; and she would not allow herself to shew half the displeasure she felt , because he had been conferring an obligation , which no want of delicacy on his part could make a trifle to her .

text: While her heart was still bounding with joy and gratitude on William ’s behalf , she could not be severely resentful of anything that injured only herself ; and after having twice drawn back her hand , and twice attempted in vain to turn away from him , she got up , and said only , with much agitation , “ Do n’t , Mr. Crawford , pray do n’t !

text: Thomas was as joyful as she could desire , and very kind and communicative ; and she had so comfortable a talk with him about William as to make her feel as if nothing had occurred to vex her , till she found , towards the close , that Mr. Crawford was engaged to return and dine there that very day .

text: “ MY DEAR FANNY,—for so I may now always call you , to the infinite relief of a tongue that has been stumbling at _ Miss _ _ Price _ for at least the last six weeks — I can not let my brother go without sending you a few lines of general congratulation , and giving my most joyful consent and approval .
text_tokenized: “ MY DEAR FANNY,—for so I may now always call you , to the infinite relief of a tongue that has been stumbling at _ Miss _ _ Price _ for at least the last six weeks — I can not let my brother go without sending you a few lines of general congratulation , and giving my most joyful consent and approval .

text: Go on , my dear Fanny , and without fear ; there can be no difficulties worth naming .
text_tokenized: Go on , my dear Fanny , and without fear ; there can be no difficulties worth naming .

text: I chuse to suppose that the assurance of my consent will be something ; so you may smile upon him with your sweetest smiles this afternoon , and send him back to me even happier than he goes .

text_tokenized: Yours affectionately , M. C.

text_tokenized: Everything natural , probable , reasonable , was against it ; all their habits and ways of thinking , and all her own demerits .

text: How could _ she _ have excited serious attachment in a man who had seen so many , and been admired by so many , and flirted with so many , infinitely her superiors ; who seemed so little open to serious impressions , even where pains had been taken to please him ; who thought so slightly , so carelessly , so unfeelingly on all such points ; who was everything to everybody , and seemed to find no one essential to him ? And farther , how could it be supposed that his sister , with all her high and worldly notions of matrimony , would be forwarding anything of a serious nature in such a quarter ?
text_tokenized: How could _ she _ have excited serious attachment in a man who had seen so many , and been admired by so many , and flirted with so many , infinitely her superiors ; who seemed so little open to serious impressions , even where pains had been taken to please him ; who thought so slightly , so carelessly , so unfeelingly on all such points ; who was everything to everybody , and seemed to find no one essential to him ? And farther , how could it be supposed that his sister , with all her high and worldly notions of matrimony , would be forwarding anything of a serious nature in such a quarter ?

text: Nothing could be more unnatural in either .
text_tokenized: Nothing could be more unnatural in either .

text: Fanny was ashamed of her own doubts .
text_tokenized: Fanny was ashamed of her own doubts .

text: Everything might be possible rather than serious attachment , or serious approbation of it toward her .
text_tokenized: Everything might be possible rather than serious attachment , or serious approbation of it toward her .

text: She had quite convinced herself of this before Sir Thomas and Mr. Crawford joined them .
text_tokenized: She had quite convinced herself of this before Sir Thomas and Mr. Crawford joined them .

text: The difficulty was in maintaining the conviction quite so absolutely after Mr. Crawford was in the room
text_tokenized: The difficulty was in maintaining the conviction quite so absolutely after Mr. Crawford was in the room

text: ; for once or twice a look seemed forced on her which she did not know how to class among the common meaning ; in any other man , at least , she would have said that it meant something very earnest , very pointed .
text_tokenized: ; for once or twice a look seemed forced on her which she did not know how to class among the common meaning ; in any other man , at least , she would have said that it meant something very earnest , very pointed .

text: But she still tried to believe it no more than what he might often have expressed towards her cousins and fifty other women .
text_tokenized: But she still tried to believe it no more than what he might often have expressed towards her cousins and fifty other women .

text: She thought he was wishing to speak to her unheard by the rest .
text_tokenized: She thought he was wishing to speak to her unheard by the rest .

text: She fancied he was trying for it the whole evening at intervals , whenever Sir Thomas was out of the room , or at all engaged with Mrs. Norris , and she carefully refused him every opportunity .
text_tokenized: She fancied he was trying for it the whole evening at intervals , whenever Sir Thomas was out of the room , or at all engaged with Mrs. Norris , and she carefully refused him every opportunity .

text: At last — it seemed an at last to Fanny ’s nervousness , though not remarkably late — he began to talk of going away ; but the comfort of the sound was impaired by his turning to her the next moment , and saying , “ Have you nothing to send to Mary ?
text_tokenized: At last — it seemed an at last to Fanny ’s nervousness , though not remarkably late — he began to talk of going away ; but the comfort of the sound was impaired by his turning to her the next moment , and saying , “ Have you nothing to send to Mary ?

text: No answer to her note ?
text_tokenized: No answer to her note ?

text: She will be disappointed if she receives nothing from you .
text_tokenized: She will be disappointed if she receives nothing from you .

text: Pray write to her , if it be only a line .
text_tokenized: Pray write to her , if it be only a line .

text: ” “ Oh yes !
text_tokenized: ” “ Oh yes !

text: certainly , ” cried Fanny , rising in haste , the haste of embarrassment and of wanting to get away—“I will write directly . ”
text_tokenized: certainly , ” cried Fanny , rising in haste , the haste of embarrassment and of wanting to get away—“I will write directly . ”

text: She went accordingly to the table , where she was in the habit of writing for her aunt , and prepared her materials without knowing what in the world to say .
text_tokenized: She went accordingly to the table , where she was in the habit of writing for her aunt , and prepared her materials without knowing what in the world to say .

text: She had read Miss Crawford ’s note only once , and how to reply to anything so imperfectly understood was most distressing .
text_tokenized: She had read Miss Crawford ’s note only once , and how to reply to anything so imperfectly understood was most distressing .

text: Quite unpractised in such sort of note - writing , had there been time for scruples and fears as to style she would have felt them in abundance : but something must be instantly written ; and with only one decided feeling , that of wishing not to appear to think anything really intended , she wrote thus , in great trembling both of spirits and hand — “ I am very much obliged to you , my dear Miss Crawford , for your kind congratulations , as far as they relate to my dearest William .
text_tokenized: Quite unpractised in such sort of note - writing , had there been time for scruples and fears as to style she would have felt them in abundance : but something must be instantly written ; and with only one decided feeling , that of wishing not to appear to think anything really intended , she wrote thus , in great trembling both of spirits and hand — “ I am very much obliged to you , my dear Miss Crawford , for your kind congratulations , as far as they relate to my dearest William .

text: The rest of your note I know means nothing ; but I am so unequal to anything of the sort , that I hope you will excuse my begging you to take no farther notice .
text_tokenized: The rest of your note I know means nothing ; but I am so unequal to anything of the sort , that I hope you will excuse my begging you to take no farther notice .

text: I have seen too much of Mr. Crawford not to understand his manners ; if he understood me as well , he would , I dare say , behave differently .
text_tokenized: I have seen too much of Mr. Crawford not to understand his manners ; if he understood me as well , he would , I dare say , behave differently .

text: I do not know what I write , but it would be a great favour of you never to mention the subject again .
text_tokenized: I do not know what I write , but it would be a great favour of you never to mention the subject again .

text: With thanks for the honour of your note , I remain , dear Miss Crawford , & c. , & c. ”
text_tokenized: With thanks for the honour of your note , I remain , dear Miss Crawford , & c. , & c. ”

text: The conclusion was scarcely intelligible from increasing fright , for she found that Mr. Crawford , under pretence of receiving the note , was coming towards her .
text_tokenized: The conclusion was scarcely intelligible from increasing fright , for she found that Mr. Crawford , under pretence of receiving the note , was coming towards her .

text: “ You can not think I mean to hurry you , ” said he , in an undervoice , perceiving the amazing trepidation with which she made up the note , “ you can not think I have any such object .
text_tokenized: “ You can not think I mean to hurry you , ” said he , in an undervoice , perceiving the amazing trepidation with which she made up the note , “ you can not think I have any such object .

text: Do not hurry yourself , I entreat . ”
text_tokenized: Do not hurry yourself , I entreat . ”

text: “ Oh !
text_tokenized: “ Oh !

text: I thank you ; I have quite done , just done ; it will be ready in a moment ; I am very much obliged to you ; if you will be so good as to give _ that _ to Miss Crawford
text_tokenized: I thank you ; I have quite done , just done ; it will be ready in a moment ; I am very much obliged to you ; if you will be so good as to give _ that _ to Miss Crawford

text: The note was held out , and must be taken ; and as she instantly and with averted eyes walked towards the fireplace , where sat the others , he had nothing to do but to go in good earnest . Fanny thought she had never known a day of greater agitation , both of pain and pleasure ; but happily the pleasure was not of a sort to die with the day ; for every day would restore the knowledge of William ’s advancement , whereas the pain , she hoped , would return no more .
text_tokenized: The note was held out , and must be taken ; and as she instantly and with averted eyes walked towards the fireplace , where sat the others , he had nothing to do but to go in good earnest . Fanny thought she had never known a day of greater agitation , both of pain and pleasure ; but happily the pleasure was not of a sort to die with the day ; for every day would restore the knowledge of William ’s advancement , whereas the pain , she hoped , would return no more .

text: She had no doubt that her note must appear excessively ill - written , that the language would disgrace a child , for her distress had allowed no arrangement ; but at least it would assure them both of her being neither imposed on nor gratified by Mr. Crawford ’s attentions .
